result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa M Clausen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to thru prison/extended supervision. Failure to pay will be a judgment.
May not possess or use firearms.

Must provide DNA sample.  Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to to be paid to thru prison/extended supervision. Failure to pay will be a judgment.
Must follow programming thru Department of Corrections.

Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Defendant Lisa M Clausen in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Defendant Lisa M Clausen in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 3:32 pm.  
Count 1 AMENDED to poss meth - 961.41(3g)(g).  Def-guilty.  CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.  
Def waiving PSI.  Qualifies for CIP & SA pgm.
SENTENCE:  3.5 yrs WSP, 18 mo IC, 2 yr ES, concurrent w/ barron 15CF277.  Credit 189 days.  DNA sample, $250 surcharge.  $290.60 fine.  Payable thru prison/ES.  FTP-judgment.  Follow programming thru DOC.  No substances.
No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.  PCR.  3:52 pm adj.
